decks.notes: The main idea behind this deck is to quickly flood the board with low-cost artifact creatures and utilize cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to buff them up and deal significant damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Galvanic Blast for direct damage and Arcbound Ravager for sacrificing artifacts to boost other creatures. The inclusion of cards like Etched Champion and Vault Skirge provide protection and lifelink capabilities to ensure sustainability while attacking aggressively. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful onslaught of artifact creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Worldspine Wurm into play using cards like Through the Breach and Goryo's Vengence. The deck also utilizes cards like Nourishing Shoal to gain life and dig for combo pieces, while also generating mana with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Desperate Ritual. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with huge creatures early in the game and close out the match before they have a chance to respond.

This Modern Aggro deck prioritizes speed and direct damage to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm, along with efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to deal as much damage as possible in the early turns. Cards like Rift Bolt and Searing Blaze help control the board while Skullcrack prevents opponents from gaining life. The strategy is to relentlessly attack, leveraging aggressive creatures and burn spells to secure a fast victory.

The main focus of this aggro Goblin deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of low-cost and efficient creature spells. By utilizing aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide, Legion Loyalist, and Foundry Street Denizen, combined with direct damage spells such as Lightning Bolt and Goblin Grenade, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent. Cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Burning-Tree Emissary help in quickly building a strong board presence, while cards like Devastating Summons can provide a late-game finisher. This deck aims to win the game swiftly through relentless aggression.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's plans by using cards like Chalice of the Void and Dismember. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Matter Reshaper. The deck also utilizes cards like Serum Powder and Simian Spirit Guide for additional consistency and speed. The overall strategy is to apply pressure early and maintain board control to secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with aggressive Merfolk creatures such as Merrow Reejerey, Master of the Pearl Trident, and Lord of Atlantis. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and Spreading Seas to disrupt the opponent's mana base, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a high number of evasive threats. Additionally, cards like Harbinger of the Tides provide tempo plays to control the board, while Kumena, Tyrant of Orazca offers card draw and further buffs to the Merfolk tribe. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and synergy to achieve victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and Molten Rain, while ramping up your own mana with Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. This allows you to quickly drop powerful threats like Inferno Titan and Bloodbraid Elf, while using cards like Primal Command and Courser of Kruphix to manipulate the board and gain incremental card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruption, while leveraging its mana advantage to stay ahead in the game.

The main focus of this UR Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through countering spells, drawing cards, and efficiently using removal spells. The deck utilizes powerful control spells like Cryptic Command and Remand, alongside versatile threats like Snapcaster Mage and Young Pyromancer. It also includes cards to disrupt opponents' mana bases, like Blood Moon, while maintaining a consistent card draw engine with Serum Visions. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents through efficient spell usage and strong card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle. By playing Primeval Titan, the deck can search for Valakut and additional Mountains to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent. This combo is supported by cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact to search for key pieces of the combo. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Slagstorm to control the board and protect the combo until it can be executed.

The main goal of this deck is to swarm the battlefield with tokens and overwhelming aggression. By utilizing cards like Intangible Virtue, Bitterblossom, and Sorin, Solemn Visitor, the deck can quickly create a strong board presence. With support cards like Path to Exile, Fatal Push, and Thoughtseize, the deck can disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining pressure. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides additional threats and ways to close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault of tokens and removal spells.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize a toolbox of creatures to assemble a powerful combo, supported by cards like Bring to Light and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. By ramping up with Utopia Sprawl and mana dorks like Arbor Elf and Birds of Paradise, the deck aims to have multiple win conditions such as Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker combo or using Restoration Angel to blink creatures for value. With access to a wide range of creatures and spells, this deck can adapt to different situations and opponents, making it a versatile and strategic deck choice for Modern format.

This deck revolves around utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Insolent Neonate to quickly cycle through the deck, discarding cards like Street Wraith and Hollow One to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. By utilizing cards like Vengevine and Reckless Bushwhacker, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures, while also utilizing cards like Bridge from Below and Walking Ballista for additional value and control options. The deck's strategy is to create a fast-paced, aggressive game plan that puts the opponent on the back foot and forces them to react quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures, utilizing cards like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Elder Deep-Fiend to apply pressure and disrupt their strategy. The deck also includes ways to control the board through cards like Chalice of the Void and Dismember, while utilizing lands like Eldrazi Temple and Cavern of Souls to help cast its high-cost creatures efficiently. By combining aggressive plays with disruptive elements, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 setting.

The main concept of this deck is to cycle through cards quickly and efficiently in order to get creatures into the graveyard, then cast Living End to bring them back into play. The deck contains a variety of cycling creatures and spells, as well as cascade spells like Violent Outburst and Demonic Dread to cascade into Living End. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while disrupting their land base with cards like Fulminator Mage and Avalanche Riders. The deck also has ways to deal with graveyard hate through cards like Faerie Macabre.

This deck focuses on the combo between Saheeli Rai and Felidar Guardian to create infinite copies of the Guardian and win the game on the spot. The deck also includes efficient removal in Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, as well as card draw and manipulation with Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage. The mana base is designed to support the combo while also providing multiple colors for the various spells in the deck. The goal is to control the board early on and then assemble the combo to quickly close out the game.

The primary strategy of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption spells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck also aims to maintain card advantage and flexibility with cards that allow for card draw, graveyard manipulation, and recursion. Additionally, the deck utilizes a selection of creatures to present threats on the board while still maintaining the control aspect of the deck. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide options for land destruction.
